decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The maximum steady brightness of the fascia sign hereby permitted is not to exceed 500 candelas per sq.m.
Reason: To ensure the sign does not have an adverse effect on the amenity of the area in accordance with Council policy LP9 of the Local Plan and to comply with paragraph 132 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Condition : 2 - The maximum steady brightness of the projecting sign hereby permitted is not to exceed 200 candelas per sq.m. 
Reason: To ensure the proposed sign does not have an adverse effect on the amenity of the area in accordance with Council policy LP9 of the Local Plan and to comply with paragraph 132 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Condition : 3 - The illumination of the signs hereby permitted shall be by static illumination only. 
Reason: In the interest of highway safety and of the visual amenities of the locality in accordance with Council policy LP9 of the Local Plan and to comply with paragraph 132 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Condition : 4 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan (2023) as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
site_name: The Fox And Hounds Public House
description: Display of externally illuminated fascia and projecting signs. Display of painted advertisement mural.
